newsitem.title: GERMANY: Exemption cuts to fund corporate tax cuts - Waigel.
newsitem.headline: Exemption cuts to fund corporate tax cuts - Waigel.

text.p: German Finance Minister Theo Waigel said on Thursday that planned cuts in corporate taxes in 1998 would be fully financed by scrapping some corporate tax exemptions.
"The commensurate financing (for the tax cuts) will come from the corporate sector," Waigel told a news conference in Bonn.
Waigel gave no details about which exemptions or tax exclusions the government had in mind, speaking only of his intention to broaden the tax base.
Earlier the government coalition said it would cut the solidarity surcharge on income tax bills two points to 5.5 percent and also cut corporate taxes in 1998.
